verses.name: 1 Thessalonians 2:15
verses.text: Who both killed the Lord Jesus, and their own prophets, and have persecuted us; and they please not God, and are contrary to all men:

verses.name: 1 Thessalonians 2:16
verses.text: Forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they might be saved, to fill up their sins alway: for the wrath is come upon them to the uttermost.

verses.name: 1 Thessalonians 2:17
verses.text: But we, brethren, being taken from you for a short time in presence, not in heart, endeavoured the more abundantly to see your face with great desire.

verses.name: 1 Thessalonians 2:18
verses.text: Wherefore we would have come unto you, even I Paul, once and again; but Satan hindered us.
